row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA study explores multinational enterprise knowledge flows

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Marissa J. Crawford
row.Description: Real GDP increased 5.0 percent, reflecting positive contributions from consumer spending, nonresidential fixed investment, federal government spending, exports, state and local government spending, and residential fixed investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Expanding the Integrated Macroeconomic Accounts’ Financial Sector
row.Author: Robert J. Kornfeld, Lisa Lynn, Takashi Yamashita
row.Description: Introducing new, more detailed statistics in the financial business sector, disaggregating this important sector into five subsectors.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: William J. Zeile
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $13.0 billion to $124.1 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing decreased $36.6 billion to $24.7 billion.

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account, 2003–2014
row.Author: Derrick T. Jenniges
row.Description: An annual supplement to the international transactions accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-border trade with net receipts of affiliates of multinational enterprises.

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Kyle L. Westmoreland
row.Description: The position was –$7,269.8 billion at the end of the third quarter of 2015, down $526.7 billion from the end of the second quarter, reflecting a $1,233.3 billion decrease in the value of U.S. assets and a $706.6 billion decrease in the value of U.S. liabilities.

row.Title: Expenditures for New Foreign Direct Investment in the United States in 2014
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: Spending by foreign direct investors to acquire, establish, or expand U.S. businesses totaled $241.3 billion in 2014. These statistics were generated from BEA’s newly reinstated and improved survey of new investment in the United States.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Quarterly Gross Domestic Product by State: Statistics for 2005 Through the Second Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lam X. Cao, Todd P. Siebeneck, Clifford H. Woodruff III
row.Description: In the second quarter of 2015, real GDP by state increased in 46 states and the District of Columbia. Real GDP growth ranged from 8.0 percent in Washington to –2.4 percent in Oklahoma.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Description: In the third quarter of 2015, state personal income growth picked up in Texas and 20 other states but slowed in 22 states, including California, Florida, and New York. Growth ranged from 2.2 percent in Nebraska and South Dakota to 0.6 percent in Alaska.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Economists' new analysis of R&D within firms

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 0.7 percent after increasing 2.0 percent in the third quarter, reflecting a deceleration in consumer spending and downturns in nonresidential fixed investment, in exports, and in state and local government spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Accounting for Household Production in the National Accounts: An Update, 1965-2014
row.Author: Benjamin Bridgman
row.Description: This satellite account updates estimates of gross domestic product to account for two types of home production activities: the production of nonmarket services and the return to consumer durable goods.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Amanda S. Lyndaker, Thomas F. Howells III, Erich H. Strassner, David B. Wasshausen
row.Description: With the release of these revised historical statistics, BEA completed its goal of developing a fully integrated time series of industry economic accounts that are consistent with the national income and product accounts.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Study offers global household production data

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.0 percent, reflecting positive contributions from consumer spending, residential fixed investment, and federal government spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Comparing Estimates of U.S. Health Care Expenditures by Medical Condition for 2000—2012
row.Author: Tina Highfill
row.Description: Estimates of spending from the BEA health care satellite account are compared with estimates from the Center for Sustainable Health Spending of the Altarum Institute.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State for the Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Todd Siebeneck
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 47 states and the District of Columbia in the third quarter. Total U.S. real GDP by state increased 1.9 percent after increasing 3.8 percent in the second quarter.

row.Title: BEA's County-Level Personal Income and Employment Estimates: An Enhanced Geocoding Methodology
row.Author: Mauricio Ortiz, Lisa Ninomiya
row.Description: A look at how the use of nine-digit ZIP codes to estimate county nonfarm proprietors' income and employment might overcome longstanding methodological issues.
row.Supp1_Title: Nonfarm proprietors' income and total income tables
row.Supp2_Title: Nonfarm proprietors employment and total employment tables

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Economists' new analysis of R&D within firms

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.4 percent, reflecting increases in consumer spending, residential fixed investment, and federal government spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Fourth Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Melissa J. Braybrooks
row.Description: Net government saving increased $82.5 billion to –$683.8 billion. Net federal government saving increased $10.0 billion to –$601.7 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $72.5 billion to –$82.1 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2017 Federal Budget
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick, Ann W. Miller
row.Description: Once a year, BEA prepares federal government estimates that are based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effects of the federal budget on U.S. economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget

row.Title: Results of the Comprehensive Revision of the Territorial Economic Accounts: New Estimates of GDP for 2014 and Revised Estimates for 2002–2013
row.Author: Kevin J. Furlong, Erin M. Ludlow
row.Description: New and updated estimates for American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Fourth Quarter of 2015 and 2015
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: In the fourth quarter of 2015, the current-account deficit decreased $4.6 billion to $125.3 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing decreased $30.2 billion to $29.4 billion. In 2015, the current-account deficit increased $94.6 billion to $484.1 billion.

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the Fourth Quarter of 2015 and 2015
row.Author: Kyle L. Westmoreland
row.Description: The net position was –$7,356.8 billion at the end of the fourth quarter of 2015, down from –$7,311.6 billion at the end of the third quarter. U.S. liabilities, valued at $30,565.1 billion, exceeded U.S. assets, valued at $23,208.3 billion.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: In the fourth quarter of 2015, state personal income growth slowed in California, Texas, Florida, New York, and in 26 other states. Growth rates ranged from –0.1 percent in Wyoming, Oklahoma, and Nebraska to 1.3 percent in Michigan.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA working paper analyzes special purpose entities

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2016
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 0.5 percent, reflecting increases in consumer spending, residential fixed investment, and federal government spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Preview of the Upcoming Annual NIPA Revision

row.Title: Preview of the 2016 Annual Revision of the International Economic Accounts
row.Author: Alexis N. Grimm, Kristy L. Howell, Daniel R. Yorgason
row.Description: A look at upcoming changes to the international transactions accounts and international investment position accounts.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Trends in U.S. Trade in Information and Communications Technology (ICT) Services and in ICT-Enabled Services
row.Author: Alexis N. Grimm
row.Description: Updated statistics that stem from a refined definition of ICT-enabled services and expanded detail on trade in services as a result of the comprehensive restructuring of the international economic accounts.

row.Title: Innovation-Related Services Trade by Multinational Enterprises: Results From an Interagency Data Link Project
row.Author: Francisco Moris, William J. Zeile
row.Description: A look a new data on multinational enterprises in the United States that engage in both research and development and international trade in innovation-related services.

row.Title: Identifying Firm Heterogeneity in Value Added and Trade for U.S. Businesses
row.Author: James J. Fetzer, Erich H. Strassner
row.Description: A presentation of a new economic accounting framework that describes the production and sourcing patterns for different types of firms in an industry.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA's plans for residual seasonality move forward; State data on refundable tax credits available

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the First Quarter of 2016
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 0.8 percent, reflecting contributions from consumer spending, residential fixed investment, and state and local government spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: First Quarter of 2016
row.Author: Melissa J. Braybrooks
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $86.1 billion to –$756.0 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $22.2 billion to –$610.0 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $63.9 billion to –$146.0 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts for 2013–2015
row.Author: Sarah Osborne, Jamie Williams
row.Description: In 2015, travel and tourism increased 4.7 percent in 2015 after increasing 2.8 percent in 2014.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: Subject Guide for January–June 2016
row.Description: A guide to the articles in these issues of the Survey.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A look at BEA's application programming interface and its International Trade and Investment Country Facts app

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the First Quarter of 2016
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.1 percent after increasing 1.4 percent in the fourth quarter of 2015. The increase primarily reflected contributions from consumer spending, residential fixed investment, state and local government spending, and exports.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Residual Seasonality in GDP and GDI: Findings and Next Steps
row.Author: Brent R. Moulton, Benjamin D. Cowan
row.Description: Research into the causes of seasonality in BEA's estimates of GDP and GDI and a look at BEA's ongoing plans to improve its seasonal adjustment procedures.

row.Title: Integrated BEA/BLS Industry-Level Production Account: Initial Statistics for 2014 and Revised Statistics for 1998–2013
row.Author: Amanda S. Lyndaker
row.Description: These statistics can be used to analyze the underlying trends in aggregate economic growth.

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the First Quarter of 2016, Year 2015, and Annual Revisions
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position decreased 3.4 percent to –$7,525.6 billion in the first quarter of 2016. The position decreased 3.3 percent to –$7,280.6 billion in 2005.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2015: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Derrick T. Jenniges, James J. Fetzer
row.Description: The U.S. direct investment abroad position grew 4.4 percent, while the foreign direct investment in the United States position grew 7.6 percent.

row.Title: Annual Revision of the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: C. Omar Kebbeh, Eric Bryda
row.Description: Revised quarterly and annual statistics that incorporate a variety of enhancements, including newly available and revised source data, updated seasonal factors, and more.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2016
row.Author: Thomas Anderson, Christopher P. Steiner
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $11.3 billion to $124.7 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing increased $13.3 billion to $35.0 billion.

row.Title: International Transactions and Positions in Financial Derivatives Other Than Reserves
row.Description: Beginning with this issue of the Survey, the statistics on transactions and positions in financial derivatives will be available on the Supplemental Statistics Web page http://bea.gov/international/supplemental_statistics.htm for the international accounts.
row.Category: International, International transactions and positions in financial derivatives other than reserves

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: Christopher Gohrband
row.Description: The estimates of financial-account flows in these accounts, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance-of-payments concepts and to close gaps in coverage.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State: New Statistics for the Fourth Quarter of 2015, Annual Statistics for 2015, and Revised Statistics for 2008–2014
row.Author: Lam Cao, Robert P. Tate
row.Description: Real GDP by state increased in 41 states and the District of Columbia in the fourth quarter of 2015. Growth rates ranged from 3.0 percent in Indiana to –3.4 percent in Wyoming.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Description: State personal income growth slowed in 23 states and fell in 2 states in the first quarter of 2016. Growth rates ranged from –1.3 percent in North Dakota to 1.5 percent in Washington state.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A look at measuring GDP at the county level

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2016
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.2 percent after increasing 0.8 percent in the first quarter of 2016. The second-quarter increase was more than accounted for by an increase in consumer spending. Exports also increased.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The 2016 Annual Update of the National Income and Product Accounts
row.Author: Stephanie H. McCulla, Shelly Smith
row.Description: Details of the annual revision, which incorporated newly available and revised source data as well as new methods and presentations.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Activities of U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Multinational Enterprises in 2014
row.Author: Sarah Stutzman
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of these foreign multinational enterprises increased 3.2 percent in 2014 after increasing 6.3 percent in 2013. Employment increased 3.1 percent after increasing 5.0 percent.

row.Title: New Foreign Direct Investment in the United States in 2015
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: Spending by foreign direct investors to acquire, establish, or expand U.S. businesses totaled $420.7 billion in 2015, compared with $250.6 billion in 2014. Employment at these businesses was 422,200, compared with 734,000 in 2014.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Real Per Capita Personal Income and Regional Price Parities for 2014
row.Author: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa, Bryan M. Vengelen
row.Description: A presentation of price-adjusted estimates of personal income. The price adjustments are based partly on regional price parities, which measure differences in price levels across states and metropolitan areas relative to the national price level.

row.Title: Quarterly Gross Domestic Product by State: Statistics for the First Quarter of 2016
row.Author: Todd P. Siebeneck, Albert H. Yoon
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 37 states and the District of Columbia. Real GDP growth ranged from 3.9 percent in Arkansas to -11.4 percent in North Dakota.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state
